Abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive guide to conducting meta-analyses in organizational research, emphasizing methodological choices that enhance validity and reliability. It explores the integration of validity generalization and effect size estimation to synthesize research findings effectively. The paper discusses the role of psychometric artifacts in influencing results and offers strategies to mitigate their impact. By examining various methodological options, the guide aims to assist researchers in selecting appropriate techniques for their specific research questions. This synthesis of methodological insights is intended to improve the rigor and applicability of meta-analytic studies, ultimately advancing the field of organizational research through more robust and generalizable findings.
